meanings.definition: A person regarded as effeminate or cowardly.
meanings.sent1: He was often teased for being a siss at school.
meanings.sent2: The bully called him a siss because he didn't want to fight.
meanings.sent3: The siss in the movie always screamed at the sight of spiders.
meanings.sent4: The villain in the story was portrayed as a siss, afraid of his own shadow.
meanings.sent5: The character's reputation as a siss followed him wherever he went.

meanings.sent1: The kettle started to siss as it boiled on the stove.
meanings.sent2: The snake began to siss loudly when approached.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to siss at the birds outside the window.
meanings.sent4: The wind made the leaves siss as it blew through the trees.
meanings.sent5: The tires of the car started to siss on the wet road.

meanings.definition: To act in a cowardly or effeminate way.
meanings.sent1: He would siss out of any challenge that came his way.
meanings.sent2: She didn't want to siss out of the race, so she kept running.
meanings.sent3: The knight was known to siss away from battles he deemed unwinnable.
meanings.sent4: The soldier refused to siss out, standing bravely in the face of danger.
meanings.sent5: The team captain encouraged his players not to siss out during the match.
